pages.title: Tool Gun
pages.text: Description $(br2)Currently can only be used for connections.$(br2)Similar to Create's schematic tool. Hold Alt before using the mouse wheel to change modes.

Connect Mode$(br)In this mode, right-click to select a device to apply a connection.$(li)Motors:$(li2)Selecting a motor will display a red frame on its face, indicating where ships will align.$(li2)Click the target block to show a yellow frame, marking the alignment face.$(li2)Right-click air to start the connection. Ships will attempt to align within 10s before constraints activate.

$(li)Joint Motor:$(li2)Right-click the Joint Motor to display perpendicular red/yellow frames. Red indicates alignment, yellow marks the rotation axis.$(li2)Right-click a block to align its red frame with the motor's red frame.$(li2)Right-click another perpendicular face to align the yellow frame.$(li2)Right-click air to finalize.$(li)Slider:$(li2)Connects similarly to the Joint Motor.

For all hinges:$(li)Right-click two hinges in sequence and then air to connect.$(li)When targeting a Revolute Joint with the Tool Gun, a red frame appears on its side to indicate rotation axis.$(li)Connected Revolute Joints will have $(bold)relative$() rotation axes. Use a wrench (Shift + Right Click) to adjust the red frame's direction.
Notes:$(li)A small red dot appears on motors when targeted, showing the actual rotation axis (including offset adjustments).$(li)Shift + Right Click air to reset the selection process.

Disconnect Mode$(br)Right-click a machine to disconnect it. For hinges without stored constraints, click both hinges.$(br2)Disconnect All Mode: Deletes $(bold)all$() constraints in a structure, including those from other mods. Use only for irrecoverable constraint errors.
